clinical_study.brief_title: Dilute Bleach Baths in Pediatric Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled, Evaluator-blinded Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of Dilute Bleach Baths on Skin Disease Control in Pediatric Patients With Atopic Dermatitis

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if twice weekly 10 minute dilute bleach baths decreases disease severity in patients with moderate to severe atopic dermatitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Eczema Area and Severity Index Score (EASI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in EASI score from baseline at 1 month and 3 month follow ups
primary_outcome.description: EASI score is recorded at baseline, 1 month and 3 month follow ups.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in IGA score from baseline at 1 month and 3month follow ups
secondary_outcome.description: IGA scores are recorded at baseline, 1 month and 3 month follow ups.

arm_group.description: Patients in the intervention group will be instructed to bathe in a dilute bleach bath twice weekly for 10 minutes.
Patients in the placebo group will be instructed to bathe in plain water twice weekly for 10 minutes.

intervention.description: Patients in the intervention group will be instructed to bathe in a dilute bleach bath twice weekly for 10 minutes.
Patients in the placebo group will be instructed to bathe in plain water twice weekly for 10 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 2-17 years of age at time of consent. A parent or legal guardian will be required to consent and authorize their enrollment in the study.
- Male or female of any ethnic background.
- English or Spanish speaking.
- A clinical diagnosis of atopic dermatitis for at least 6 months prior to enrollment.
- Must have moderate to severe atopic dermatitis as rated by the EASI score.
- Able to adhere to study visit schedule and other protocol requirements.
- Patients and/or family members must agree to not use any other prescription or over the counter medications other than the ones prescribed by the study protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical evidence of bacterial or viral superinfection on first visit.
- Have received phototherapy within 2 months prior to enrollment.
- Have received any systemic medication for atopic dermatitis or any that may affect evaluation of atopic dermatitis within 2 months prior to enrollment.
- Have a known hypersensitivity response, including anaphylaxis, to any of the topicals used for treatment (i.e. topical steroids, bleach)
- Participation in another clinical trial using an investigational agent or procedure.
- Pregnant or planning pregnancy or surgery during the participation in the study.
